uh concurrency which is through an isolate model and so we've taken lessons learned from other platforms that you
can do shared memory threads but they lead to deadlocks and they're really hard to debug and they they require then
things like locks and mutxes and just way more complexity uh so we took a cue from Heirlang and probably others and
said well what if we actually shared no state between these separate little running bits of code um and instead just
pass messages and if you're not sharing state then you can't have two threads kind of clobber each other and get into deadlocks okay we like this model uh
especially because JavaScript itself is a single threaded execution model so again going back to that we can't design
anything into the language that can't compile the same JavaScript uh Dart has to kind of play in that world and so we
took these kind of cues and built a system we call isolates an isolate is an isolated memory heap or a logical
logically isolated memory heap uh that can run in a separate thread or a separate process kind of depends on on
the implementation and you pass messages back and forth between these different isolates um much like Erling and its
actors um much like web workers and JavaScript you might fire off a web worker and pass messages back and forth
